headline: Pecan Sour Cream Coffee Cake
description: This is the best coffee cake recipe if you love crispy, crunchy, buttery crumb toppings. Chef John uses twice as many crumbs — there's even a layer inside!
name: Pecan Sour Cream Coffee Cake
recipeIngredient: 1 cup sour cream or creme fraiche

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter an 8x10-inch baking dish.

Make the topping: Mix pecans, white sugar, brown sugar, melted butter, cinnamon, and salt together in a mixing bowl until thoroughly combined and all components are coated with butter, 3 to 4 minutes.
Make the cake: Whisk flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a medium bowl.

Mix sugar and butter together in a large bowl with a spatula until well blended. Whisk in eggs, one at a time, until thoroughly incorporated. Whisk in sour cream and vanilla. Gradually whisk in flour mixture until flour is just incorporated; do not overmix.

Spread 1/2 of the batter over the bottom of the prepared baking dish, then sprinkle with 1/2 of the topping. Carefully spoon remaining batter over topping, then sprinkle with remaining topping; very gently press topping into batter.
Bake in the preheated oven until a bamboo skewer inserted into the center comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes. Let cool slightly before serving.

review.reviewBody: so moist. My last one was hard as week old bread

Delicious!!!! This recipe was a huge hit. Perfectly moist, great crumble and flavour. Used a different cake mold, so I scaled down the recipe a little, but kept the same ratios. Came out perfectly. Wouldn’t change anything.
This is, by far, the best coffee cake I have ever eaten. I took it to an event and everyone wanted the recipe

Very good! I made this with no changes to the ingredients. Instead of one 8 x 10 pan, I used 2 loaf pans. When I got to the 2nd layer of cake, I dropped in spoonfuls of the batter. I put it into the oven for 5 minutes. This allowed the batter to spread out. I then smoothed it out to the edges and topped it with the remaining pecan crumbles. That was so much easier than trying to spread the layers as instructed. This is my new go to coffee cake recipe. It is so much moister than most coffee cakes.
Deliciously scrumptious.
Love the recipe. I doubled the streusel for more filling. YUm!

I used an 8x8 inch pan for this recipe. I have made this twice, once for my husband's men's club meeting in May, and today. I had some pecans in the freezer that were near the expiration date, so I decided to make this again. The batter is very thick, and it's somewhat difficult to place the batter over the middle layer of the crumb crunch. I'll make this again!
This is the best coffee cake I have ever made. I took it to a brunch and everyone wanted the recipe. I was a super star that morning
I agree with a previous comment that it was too eggy and it was heavy. Love the nut mixture. I used a Bundt pan, 35 minutes at 350 worked well.
This was delicious...definitely a keeper. I had to use a 9x9 and bake it about 35 mins but I wouldn't change a thing.
So Yummy!! I will be making this again!!

omg...my apartment smells so wonderful..has to be thee best coffee cake I ever tasted too...I added that extra flour so batter was thicker so I added in some oil and water to thin it out...I did not add flour into the topping mix? I added a little more butter and sugar into topping mix...layering the topping over the two layers...was easily spreadable and I mixed some into the batter in swirls too...I ate mine warm...so good is all I can say...I used a smaller pan, made bottom layer thicker and swirled in some topping too into it...just scrumptious is all I can say, and I am going for a second piece too?

Doubled the recipe and after doing the 1 3/4 cups flour twice I put 2 of the additional 2 tbsp flour in the batter and 2 of them in the topping mixture (that equals the 1 7/8 cups flour twice - insert giant eye roll). Used 9 x 13 pan for this double recipe put probably a little more than half in bottom, added 1/2 topping mixture. Then tried to gently spread out the kind of sparse amount of batter I had left-- but it rose so much you never would have known these was more in the bottom layer! It was sooo delicious!! See photos!

Was wonderful! Loved this coffee cake! The only things I changes was pan size "9x9 stoneware", 1 tablespoon cinnamon(we LOVE cinnamon) and all brown sugar. Had to bake an additional 5 minutes. Will definitely make again!

Oh my, this is IT!! There is a reason this recipe gets hundreds of 5 star ratings. It is truly delicious. The top and middle filling have 2 different textures and flavors which doubles the taste explosion, and the cake parts are so moist and soooo good. I doubled the cinnamon and had to cook longer than called for, but it is truly just a few degrees short of being decadent. This has WOW power!!
Not sure why some of the other reviews say it was to eggy. Maybe they just can’t bake well. I have made this x5 and every time it’s perfect. Enough said.
Excellent and easy to make
This was a delicious cake. I had fun making it. Thanks for the great recipe Chef John.

Made cake as written. It took longer to put together than I expected but was worth the effort. Excellent texture and taste, but I expected a different taste. Just didn’t have the traditional coffee cake taste. Would make again and add more cinnamon and maybe more sour cream

I loved the finished product. Was a little surprised at how doughy the batter was. Was a little like working with bread dough. Thought I did something wrong but it came out lovely. I doubled the recipe and put in a 9x12 pan and of course it took longer to bake (I don't set timer, just keep checking to see if middle is cooked all the way through). I did add 2 Tbs flour to the topping so it was more crumbly but I think either way the topping would be yummy. Just watch the video and it gives you a good idea of what the recipe should look like.
Great nice use of spices and not to dry, overall I would make this again I loved it!
A great recipe, my husband loved it! I made no changes. Will be the only coffee cake I will make for now on. Thank you for sharing.

I made this for a Wake for a Dear Friend at Our Church. Everyone Loved It. One person even thought it was professionally made! ( I hade used my food processor to to finely grind the topping together. The texture was Wonderful!

My family LOVED this coffee cake! The only change I made was I doubled the recipe and baked it in a DEEP 9x13 inch glass dish. The crunchy filling and topping is superb, flavorful and plentiful. The cake is not overly sweet, which I think is perfect for a coffee cake. Highly recommend.
This was delicious! Not difficult to make. The whole family loved it.

took longer to cook, don't use kosher salt, too coarse
otherwise very tasty
The best coffee cake recipe I have ever made! Simple and delicious.
We have served this for visiting guest and they love it. We never have any leftover.
Love this coffee cake. Turns out perfectly every time!
I get rave reviews when I make this. And I will never make another recipe. It is sooooo good.

I successfully halved this recipe and baked in a loaf pan ~ the only substitution I made was using plain Greek yogurt instead of sour cream because I didn’t have any of the latter! ~ it worked terrifically. This is a moist light flavorful coffee cake. I adore Chef John. His recipes are easy to follow even when they may include many steps or ingredients. This is a perfect treat with morning coffee.
Made it tonight for breakfast tomorrow . Made just the way the recipe stated. Came out SOOOO good!
Fabulous. Hubby is the coffee cake junkie and he’d give this 10 stars. Absolutely loved it. Light and full of flavor. Making again this weekend for Father’s Day.
This coffee cake was FANTASTIC. My only change was that I made it in a 8 X 8 square pan and cooked it a little longer due to the size change.
Absolutely the best coffee cake. My family devoured it instantly. Had to make another quickly. Love it!!
I have made this literally dozens of times. It is my husband’s favorite. Occasionally I will try another recipe, but they are never as good. This is THE ONE.

It tastes wonderful. I did add some cinnamon chips to the crumb mixture, but otherwise, I made it as written. The cake is moist and the crumb layers are nice.

Following directions, I feel like I got every bowl in the house dirty. It's not a spur-of-the-moment weekend treat for me.

The coffee cake was excellent. The cake was moist and delicious. I used a loaf pan which was my mistake. It caused two issues. First, it required much more time to cook; that was not a big deal. Second, and more problematic, there were too many pecans for the surface area of the loaf pan. When I took the cake out of the pan, the top and bottom halves came apart at the interior line of the nuts/sugar mixture. I put it back together and enjoyed every bite, but next time will use a different pan or will use fewer pecans.
We used Walnuts instead of Pecans, it was so good that we went for seconds. One more thing, we used a little less sugar. It was the best tasting cake, ever!

I was looking for a simple, super quick dessert to make that was something other than a traditional cake. This was the perfect choice. I added a tiny bit of a powdered sugar glaze over it ... for looks mostly. Loved it!

Absolutely SUPERB Coffe Cake! Simultaneously moist and crunchy. Best thing I have had since an old Betty Crocker mix coffee cake I remember from the '70's that they don't even make anymore. (If anyoe knows how to make that one, let me know?) But this could indeed be better. Thanks again Chef John for another great recipe.
I loved this, read the comments. I too added some more pecans and sourcream. I also used a wet spoon to spread the batter and worked like a charm will deffinatly make again
My first time baking this type of cake and this recipe is the bomb!
amazing cake.
Perfect as is, I threw a handful of chocolate chips on top for my kids, everyone raved about this coffee cake.
I made twice the pecan filling and followed the recipe otherwise as written. I also made a simple glaze and decorated with whole pecans. superb

My boyfriend and I really enjoyed the cake! I made the following adjustments due to dietary choices- I used 3/4 oat flour (I processed rolled oats until fine in my food processor) and substituted the refined white sugar with Monk Fruit Sweetener. I forgot how sweet it can be, so I should have cut back the amount in the cake to two-thirds cup (maybe even a half cup for my taste). My boyfriend has a sweet tooth, so he is fine with it however! I also took the suggestion from one of the other comments and used the extra two tablespoons in the crumb praline. The praline is delicious and the cake is moist and buttery. I will definitely make it again! It's a great way to use up extra sour cream when you buy it for another recipe but don't otherwise use it often like me.
I totally changed this recipe to make it a Bourbon Honey Coffee Cake.

I used my stand mixer to cream the butter, sugar and all the wet ingredients. I mixed the dry ingredients separately as the recipe suggested and then incorporated quickly into the wet ingredients with the paddle attachment. For the filling/topping I left the nuts probably a bit chunkier than the recipe suggested. It took at least 40 minutes to bake and wasn’t in the least dry with a nice texture and flavor. The next time I make it I’ll try to put more batter on the bottom than I did. All in all a great recipe and I’ll make it again.
Best ever! Absolutely delicious. I’ve tried so many different recipes searching for one that tastes like this. Thank you, Chef John! My searching days are over
Easy and delicious!
Yummy! However, not near enough toping for a 9X15! Double that topping recipe!

This recipe is so delicious. I will definitely make it again & again!! I had to make a few changes & used gluten free flour & allspice instead of cinnamon. The topping is delicious & the cake is perfect. I’ve already shared it with several friends. 
Thank you Chef John for a great recipe!!
This was our Christmas dessert. I wasn't allowed to take my pan home! It was returned empty!! Definitely will make this again. Very easy.
All I can say is that this coffee cake is excellent ! It will be my go to from now on

My husband said this cake was evil. He is on a diet... but hey it's the holidays so thought it would be ok :) We can't stop eating it! I left out 1/8 cup flour because 1 7/8 cups flour is just weird and using 1 3/4 cups worked totally fine. I also changed to 1 TBSP cinnamon (as per some other recipes I read) and used an 8x8 dish. Come on now Chef John... who other than a chef has an 8 x 10 size dish??!! I did need to cook it longer as others said but came out great!

Holy moly! So good, I’m surprised it’s not illegal. First, I want to thank “cheching” for doing the math and stating that 1 and 7/8ths cups is basically 1 and 3/4 cups plus 2 tbls. I watched Chef John’s video last night and set my stick of butter out before going to bed so I didn’t have any issues with stiffness (he cracks me up!) I followed the directions, with minor exceptions. Used walnuts instead of pecans since that is what I had on hand, then did a heaping cup of them. Also used a heaping cup of sour cream in the batter. Baked for 30 minutes then let cool for 45 minutes. This is the best coffee cake I’ve ever had.
Fantastic! I made this for Easter morning during quarantine and it was a hit! The rich flavors went together very well and the pecans added a lovely crunch.

Made it and it turned out exactly like the photo. I replaced pecans with walnuts and up it to 3 cups chopped. I would use a smaller cake pan next time for more height. Otherwise won’t change a thing. Great recipe!
wasn't anything wrong with it but it seems a bit overrated. missing something

By far one of the best recipes I’ve made from Allrecipes. Very moist and flavorful. I was honestly very surprised at how this recipe turned out. The sour cream is key...fresh pecans also. Loved it. I did use a smaller pan (8x8) thinking there wasn’t enough batter for a 13x9”. I won’t make that mistake again. I do think it would have been better in the bigger size. Still good tho. Saved recipe.

Excellent coffee cake - great reviews. Baked in 10x10 pyrex. Took suggestion of another reviewer and added a bit more sour cream (about 1/4). I was confused by directions however... directions state to mix butter/sugar with a spatula.. that sounds like hand mixing to me. I used a mixer. It then says to "whisk" in eggs... again i used mixer on low. vs hand whisk
Thank you Chef John. The mix and all ingredients was so easy to prepare. Cook time was right in the money. Delicious Coffeehouse coffee cake
Made it twice, it was so good
1 and 7/8 cups is 14 oz weighed. This is the best
Really good. Really. Made it several times w/no deviations from recipe. Only problem was when I accidentally over baked it by a few minutes. Ruined it. Be careful with the timing.
Amazing recipe. My family loved it. My dad is not a fan of really sweet desserts but he enjoyed this one. Definitely going to make this one again.

I wanted a 9 x 13 cake, so I did 1.5 times the amounts. (I had to put on my thinking cap to figure out the correct amount of flour!) It was just right for a 9 x 13 pan: a nice, tall cake without threatening to spill over the edges. I think I baked it for 45 min. Also, I didn't have quite enough sour cream so used a bit of vanilla yogurt and melted butter to supplement, and it still turned out delicious. A definite keeper!

Absolutely delicious! Simple to make, delightful with coffee or a mid day pick me up. All who have tasted it loved the extra crumble within the cake. Very tasty. 
Pauline
too sweet

super yum!
I made it in a 9x9 and baked it for an additional 5 minutes. next time I'll try it in muffin cups for easy breakfast on the go.
Chef John, you weren’t kidding. This cake is so delicious. It’s perfect. No changes or alterations needed of any kind. My husband’s fav. Thank you??

So first let me say this was a very good, moist Crumb Cake. I can see how some people were confused by the instructions and the 8th measurements, in my experience, they are not super common unless you are a “chef” or advanced baker. In Step 4 the ½ cup butter in the cake needs to be “softened” the instructions do not say that. It’s a given for most but not novice/intermediate bakers. The batter mixes up thick and is difficult to continue mixing with a Wisk when the flour is added, I used a wooden spoon. Once the thick 2nd layer needs to be added to the pan, I placed the mix into a gallon baggie, cut a bottom corner off and squeezed it like a snake onto the middle crumb layer, this helped it spread a little easier. Don’t be afraid to just quickly spread it with a spatula, the middle crumb layer will not get completely mixed up and for the most part stays put. I also doubled the Crumb mixture & left out the nuts since I had none at the time. I used a clear 8x11 glass pan and it took about 50 mins to bake.
Excellent - especially the crumble.
Addictive because of the amazing flavor. I drizzled icing over it while warm to have it sink in.
I added a bit of cinnamon to the mixture before adding the topping- other than that this recipe is perfect!
I added raisins, really good
Delicious, followed the recipe except using almond nuts instead of pecan since it is not available. Added to my favorites, wis ill definitely make again. Thank you for the recipe,
Absolutely delicious!

This was my first try at a crumble cake and this recipe was perfect! I was so worried about the crumble getting hard or the cake remaining raw from inside. But I started monitoring from 25 mins and went up to 35 mins and it was perfect.
Changes I made:
1. I used a different pan. Since I didn’t have an 8x10, I used two 9x5 loads pans which were a bit deeper.
2. In one of the pans, I used the recipe as is. In the second one, I used the batter but instead of the crumble, I used fresh strawberries in the middle layer and on the top. I also used Meyer lemon zest from 1 lemon and 3 tea spoon lemon juice to create a lemon and strawberry cake. I took this one out of the oven at 32 mins and let the crumble stay on till 36 mins.
The recipe call for an 8 x 10 pan but it really filled the pan and took much longer to bake. Next time I make it, I will use a 13 x 9 pan.
This coffee cake is DELICIOUS! The only thing is it usually takes 90 minutes to cook.

And, although the coffee cake was good, because I used salked butter, it was just a bit to salted for me. I will make again and use unsalted. I may even not put the crumble inside, but just add to the top.
Made per recipe with no changes. Great taste and texture.

I made this as written, although I used a 9x9 square pan and extended the cook time for 10 minutes. It was delicious. Light, Fluffy with wonderful topping and filling. This recipe is destined to be made frequently.
Best coffee cake I've had! Definitely give this a try!!!

Made it exactly as stated. I knew I was in for something good b/c the batter was so delicious. This is the best tasting coffee cake I’ve ever made!
I hand stirred instead of using my mixer (which I usually do). I believe this made a huge difference in the end.
This will be my go-to coffee cake.
MY whole family enjoyed this cake.

I made this exactly like the recipe and it turned out great! Spreading the second layer of batter over the first layer of crumbles was tough, my batter was very thick and sticky so I thought I had done something wrong but it came out perfect. My husband said he wouldn't change a thing. We'll definitely make this again.
Very delicious
Super good!
Love this

Wow! The flavor of the cake and crumb topping is amazing. The cake is moist, topping is crunchy and not too overpowering. Just the right amount of cinnamon and right quantity of crumb for middle and top. 

This is the first time I have made it and I followed directions except I added slightly less than 2 cups flour and substituted slivered almonds for pecans. I also cooked it in an 8 X 11 glass dish.

The reason for one less star is the cake is very slightly overdone on the edges and corners. It may be due to my convection oven but it took a while for the cake to be done in the center so the edges are over done. Total time was 39 minutes which I thought would be less using convection and a slightly larger pan. Also, the batter is thick so spreading it can be tricky.

Overall great coffee cake and I will be making it again!

Excellent recipe - I didnt have any pecans, so used what was left of my almonds and hazelnuts, chopped and roasted. The extra 2T of flour from the recipe (called for 1 7/8 cups) to the topping and layered in my bundt pan to keep topping from sinking. Otherwise, I increased the butter in topping by 1T and added one small egg I had hanging around to the cake mix. Also didnt have enough sour cream, so I finished off with some greek yogurt. 
It all came out just wonderful! Keeping this one for sure!
This is very good. I was concerned because my cake batter was very thick and a little hard to spread over the layer of pecan mix. It turned out great. I think the cake would be delish by itself.
put 2 1/2 cups pecans and added extra egg also used vanilla nut flavoring
This recipe is very forgiving I forgot to cream my butter and sugar and even forgot 3/4 a cup of flour and with extra baking time it still turned out great.
Excellent. No changes needed for high altitude. Cooking time was 55 minutes.
I increased the pecans to 1 3/4 cups. This cake was VERY moist and flavorful. It will be gobbled up fast. Thank you!
